<fred@...> writes:

> http://shopthroughtheages.com/unitedcutleryswords.html
> http://shopthroughtheages.com/paulchenswords.html
> http://shopthroughtheages.com/inhouseswords.html

Not too many of us are using swords like this for cutting.

I think with swords at these levels, you're running a major risk of
injuring yourself through equipment failure.

From what some of the guys write, you may be better off with the stuff
at www.bugei.com and/or ask your questions there.

- darcy
